meanings.definition: A substance that initiates or promotes the formation of nuclei in a solution.
meanings.sent1: The nucleator helped the tiny particles come together in the liquid.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use a nucleator to start the crystal growth process.
meanings.sent3: The nucleator in the experiment was like a magic wand for the molecules.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a nucleator, sparking a chain reaction of ideas in the group.
meanings.sent5: The nucleator was like a match lighting up the darkness of the solution.

meanings.definition: One who or that which nucleates.
meanings.sent1: The skilled nucleator guided the formation of the new organization.
meanings.sent2: As a nucleator, he was responsible for initiating the project.
meanings.sent3: The nucleator at the party was the one who got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a nucleator, bringing joy to those around her.
meanings.sent5: The nucleator was like a conductor orchestrating the start of something new.
